bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Betty Randolph Boggess Hollingsworth, (1928-2016), Elizabeth Eleanor Peery and John Randolph Boggess in southwestern Virginia. She attended University of Kentucky from 1947 to 1950 and earned a Bachelor's of Arts in Journalism. She taught for one year at The Cove School in Tazewell, Virginia. On December 17, 1951, she married Kent Hollingsworth. They lived in Georgetown, Kentucky and had five children: Val French, Randolph, Amery, and Letitia. After Betty and Kent divorced in 1981, she moved to Merrick Place in Lexington, Kentucky and worked for the Bluegrass Land and Nature Trust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Betty Randolph Boggess Hollingsworth series (1933-2005, undated) comprises personal and family papers primarily from soon before and after she married Kent Hollingsworth in 1951. A significant part of the series includes letters from students she taught at Cove School in Tazewell, Virginia, family members, and from her husband, Kent. The series also includes some genealogical information about the Boggess, Peery, and Garst family of southwest Virginia.
